overview: Richard J. Williams has a successful track record of investing in middle market companies since 1990. Prior to co-founding WestView Capital Partners, he was a Partner in Tudor Investment Corporationâ€™s private equity group. Tudor is a globally recognized investment manager with over $10 billion in total capital and more than $500 million under management in its private equity area. While at Tudor, Rick focused on investing in growth-oriented service companies. Prior to joining Tudor in 2000, Rick was a Managing Director of Triumph Capital Group, a Boston-based private equity firm with more than $800 million in capital. During his ten years at Triumph, he led numerous investments in middle market companies in a variety of recapitalization, growth financing, leveraged buyout and consolidation transactions. Before joining Triumph in 1990, Rick was an Associate in the investment banking group of Drexel Burnham Lambert.
